tuv.seg: Applying for your first Irish passport
Ag déanamh iarratais ar phas Éireannach
A passport is an internationally recognised travel document confirming your identity and nationality and you are only entitled to an Irish passport if you are an Irish citizen
Is é is pas ann ná cáipéis taistil a aithnítear go hidirnáisiúnta a dheimhníonn d’aitheantas agus do náisiúntacht agus ní bheidh tú i dteideal pas Éireannach ach amháin más saoránach Éireannach thú
This document explains how to apply for your first Irish passport
Tugtar míniú sa doiciméad seo ar conas iarratas a dhéanamh ar do chéad phas Éireannach agus cén uair nach mbeidh do sheanphas Éireannach agat a thuilleadh
In other documents you will find information on:
Gheobhaidh tú faisnéis i ndoiciméid eile faoi na nithe seo:
• Renewing an Irish passport
• Pas Éireannach a athnuachan
• Replacing a lost or stolen passport
• Pas caillte nó goidte a athsholáthar
Your passport is an important legal document
Cáipéis dlí thábhachtach is ea do phas
At all times, you should ensure that it is kept in a secure place
Ba cheart duit a chinntiú go bhfuil sé á choimeád in áit shábháilte i gcónaí
Each Irish passport carries a unique identification number and you should keep a note of your number, in the event that your passport is lost or stolen
Tá uimhir aitheantais uathúil ag gach pas Éireannach agus ba cheart duit d'uimhir a nótáil, sa chás go gcailltear nó go ngoidtear do phas
As well as allowing you to travel abroad, your Irish passport entitles you to certain diplomatic support services from Irish embassies abroad should you get into difficulties

Anuas ar chead a thabhairt duit taisteal thar lear, tugann do phas Éireannach teidlíocht duit i leith seirbhísí tacaíochta dioplómaitiúla áirithe ó ambasáidí na hÉireann i dtíortha thar lear sa chás go mbíonn deacrachtaí agat
While your Irish passport is an internationally recognised travel document, it does not give you an automatic right to enter other countries
Cé gur cáipéis taistil a aithnítear go hidirnáisiúnta é do phas Éireannach, ní thugann sé ceart uathoibríoch duit chun dul isteach i dtíortha eile
Your Irish passport is issued by the Irish Government through the Passport Service of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade here in Ireland
Eisíonn Rialtas na hÉireann do phas Éireannach tríd an tSeirbhís Pasanna sa Roinn Gnóthaí Eachtracha agus Trádála anseo in Éirinn
Irish passports are also issued through Irish embassies and consulates throughout the world, to whom you apply if you are living abroad
Chomh maith leis sin, eisítear pasanna Éireannacha trí ambasáidí Éireannacha agus trí chonsalachtaí Éireannacha ar fud na cruinne

The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has introduced a new credit-card sized Irish passport card which you can use for travel within the European Union/European Economic Area (includes Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway) and Switzerland

Thug an Roinn Gnóthaí Eachtracha agus Trádála cárta nua pas Éireannaigh ar chóiméid le cárta creidmheasa isteach ar féidir leat a úsáid chun taisteal laistigh den Aontas Eorpach/an Limistéar Eorpach Eacnamaíochta (áirítear leis seo an Íoslainn, Lichtinstéin agus an Iorua) agus an Eilvéis
For all other travel you must use your normal passport
Chun taisteal chuig aon áit eile, caithfidh tú do ghnáthphas a úsáid
Further information is available in our document on the Irish passport card
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise inár gcáipéis ar an gcárta pas Éireannach
If you would like to apply for a second passport for business purposes, you must provide evidence to support your application
Tá saoránaigh Éireannacha atá ag taisteal chuig áiteanna taobh amuigh den AE faoi réir shrianta pas agus cheanglais ar leith na dtíortha sin
Second passports for business purposes are issued with restricted periods of validity
Ciallaíonn sé sin, mar shampla, gur féidir go bhfuil sé riachtanach go mbeadh do phas bailí ar feadh tréimhse ar leith agus tú ag taisteal taobh amuigh den AE
Information on second passports is available on the Department's website
Bíonn na socrúcháin éagsúil ó thír go tír

Irish citizens travelling to destinations outside the EU are subject to the specific passport controls and requirements of those countries. This means, for example, when travelling outside the EU, your passport may need to be valid for a certain period
Mar sin, déan teagmháil le hambasáid na tíre lena mbaineann sula dtaistealaíonn tú, chun an fhaisnéis is déanaí a fháil maidir leis na ceanglais sin
All EU citizens have the right to enter and live in the territory of another member state of the EU for up to three months
Tá an ceart ag gach saoránach den AE dul isteach i gcríoch ballstáit eile den AE agus cónaí a bheith orthu ann ar feadh trí mhí ar a mhéad
You simply present a valid passport or national identity card; no other formality is required
Níl le déanamh ach pas bailí nó cárta aitheantais náisiúnta bailí a thaispeáint; ní theastaíonn aon fhoirmiúlacht eile
EU countries cannot set additional conditions concerning the minimum validity or duration of the identity card or passport
Ní féidir le tíortha den AE coinníollacha breise a shocrú maidir le híosbhailíocht ná le híosfhad an chárta aitheantais nó an phas
Basically this means that your passport doesn't have to be valid for, say, 6 months before you are allowed enter another EU country
Go bunúsach, ciallaíonn sé sin nach bhfuil sé riachtanach do phas a bheith bailí ar feadh 6 mhí, mar shampla, sula mbíonn cead agat dul isteach i dtír eile den AE
A machine-readable passport is a passport with two typeface lines printed at the bottom of the biographical page , which can be read by machine
Is é is pas inléite ag meaisín ann ná pas ag a bhfuil dhá líne chló-aghaidhe priontáilte ag bun an leathanaigh bheathaisnéisigh ar féidir le meaisín iad a léamh
When read, these lines electronically provide identical information to that provided on the biographical page
Nuair a léitear iad, soláthraíonn na línte sin go leictreonach faisnéis atá ar aon dul leis an bhfaisnéis atá ar an leathanach beathaisnéiseach
In October 2006 the Passport Office began issuing Irish electronic passports (ePassport)
I mí Dheireadh Fómhair 2006, chuir Oifig na bPasanna tús le ríomhphasanna Éireannacha (r-Phas) a eisiúint
An electronic passport is the same as a normal machine-readable passport with the addition of a small integrated circuit or chip embedded in the photo page
Déanann an tslis stóráil ar íomhá dhigitithe den ghrianghraf agus ar shonraí pearsanta shealbhóir an phas mar atá siad ar leathanach sonraí an phas

The chip securely stores a digitised image of the photo and personal details of the passport holder as they appear on the data page of the passport, which allows the use of facial recognition technology at border controls
Tríd sin, is féidir úsáid a bhaint as teicneolaíocht aghaidh-aitheanta ag rialuithe teorann
You must be an Irish citizen in order to be eligible for an Irish passport
Ní mór duit a bheith i do shaoránach Éireannach le bheith i dteideal pas Éireannach
You have a right to apply for a passport if you are aged 18 years or over
Beidh an ceart agat iarratas a dhéanamh ar phas má tá tú 18 mbliana d’aois nó níos sine
If you are under 18, you will need the consent of both parents or guardian(s) in writing in order to get your own passport - see our document on passports for children

Má tá tú faoi bhun 18 mbliana d’aois, teastóidh cead uait ó do bheirt tuismitheoirí nó chaomhnóirí i scríbhinn le go mbeidh tú in ann do phas féin a fháil - féach ár ndoiciméad maidir le pasanna do leanaí
Titles such as Mr, Mrs, Ms, Dr, Rev., Sir, Lord, Lady are not entered on Irish passports
Ní chuirtear teidil amhail Uas., Bn, Dr, Urram., Ridire, Tiarna, Bantiarna ar phasanna Éireannacha
A passport may be issued in the married or civil partnership name of an applicant if a civil marriage certificate or a civil partnership certificate is submitted
Féadfar pas a eisiúint in ainm pósta/páirtnéireachta sibhialta an iarratasóra má sholáthraítear teastas pósta shibhialta nó teastas páirtnéireachta sibhialta

If the name you are known by is different from the name on your birth certificate and it is not due to marriage, civil partnership or adoption, you will have to supply documentary evidence that you have been continually using the name for at least 2 years

Murab ionann an t-ainm a thugtar ort agus an t-ainm ar do theastas breithe agus munar amhlaidh sin de bharr pósta, páirtnéireachta sibhialta nó uchtaithe, beidh ort fianaise dhoiciméadach a sholáthar a dhearbhaíonn go bhfuil an t-ainm in úsáid agat ar feadh 2 bhliain ar a laghad
If the name you are known by is the Irish version of your name but you do not have proof of 2 years’ usage, proof of at least 6 months’ usage may be accepted
Má úsáideann tú an leagan Gaeilge de d'ainm, féadfar glacadh le cruthúnas úsáide ar a laghad 6 mhí, muna bhfuil cruthúnas 2 bhliain úsáide agat
If the proof of 6 months’ usage is accepted, the English version of your name will also be noted on the passport
Má ghlactar leis an cruthúnas úsáide 6 mhí, cuirfear an leagan Béarla de d'ainm ar an bpas freisin
Examples of documentation showing proof of usage include a driving licence, bank statements, insurance, tax and social welfare documents
Áirítear le samplaí den doiciméadúchán a chruthaíonn úsáid an leagain sin: ceadúnas tiomána; ráitis bhainc; doiciméid árachais, chánach agus leasa shóisialaigh
You should include at least 2 examples with your application
Ba cheart duit 2 shampla ar a laghad a chur le d’iarratas

If the name on your passport will not be exactly the same as the name on your birth certificate, you can indicate on the application form that you also want your birth certificate name noted on the passport

Murab ionann go díreach an t-ainm ar do phas agus an t-ainm ar do theastas breithe, féadfaidh tú a chur in iúl ar an bhfoirm iarratais gur mian leat an t-ainm ar do theastas breithe a nótáil ar an bpas
This can help to avoid difficulties if you apply for a visa or work permit abroad
Féadann sé sin cabhrú chun deacrachtaí a sheachaint má dhéanann tú iarratas ar víosa nó ar chead oibre thar lear
Four recent identical photographs of the passport holder must be included with each application
Ní mór ceithre ghrianghraf chomhionanna a tógadh le déanaí de shealbhóir an phas a chur san áireamh le gach iarratas
Two of these should be signed on the back by the person who witnesses the application
Ba cheart dhá cheann díobh a bheith sínithe ar an gcúl ag an duine a fhianaíonn an t-iarratas
The witness should also write the form number shown in Section 9 of the application form on those two photographs
Ba cheart don fhinné an uimhir foirme a thaispeántar i gCuid 9 den fhoirm iarratais a scríobh ar an dá ghrianghraf sin
If you are applying in Ireland the witness must be a member of the Garda Síochána
Más rud é go bhfuil iarratas á dhéanamh agat in Éirinn, caithfidh an finné a bheith ina bhall/ball den Gharda Síochána
If you are applying abroad, suitable categories of witness are listed on the application form
Más rud é go bhfuil iarratas á dhéanamh agat thar lear, tá catagóirí d’fhinnéithe liostaithe ar an bhfoirm iarratais
The witness should enter their daytime contact number on the application form as this may need to be verified by the Passport Service or Mission
Ba cheart don fhinné a (h)uimhir theagmhála lae a chur isteach ar an bhfoirm iarratais mar gur féidir go mbeidh ar an tSeirbhís Pasanna nó ar Mhisean iad a fhíorú
More detailed information on passport photographs is available here
Tá faisnéis níos mine faoi ghrianghraif phas ar fáil anseo
Lost or stolen Irish passports
Pasanna Éireannacha atá caillte nó goidte
You can now apply online to replace your passport
Comhlánaigh Cuid 6 den fhoirm iarratais
First, you will need to report the loss or theft to the Garda Síochána (or to the local police if abroad)
Cuir an fhoirm isteach i dteannta an doiciméadúcháin riachtanaigh faoi mar a bheadh sé ar an gcéad iarratas atá á dhéanamh agat ar phas
You can view more detailed information in our document on how to replace a lost or stolen Irish passport
Is féidir breathnú ar fhaisnéis níos mine inár ndoiciméad conas pas Éireannach atá caillte nó goidte a athsholáthar
The fees when applying for an Irish passport using An Post's Passport Express (see below) or through an embassy or consulate are:
Is mar seo a leanas atá na táillí i bhfeidhm agus iarratas á dhéanamh ar phas Éireannach ach úsáid as Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais de chuid An Post (féach thíos) nó trí ambasáid nó trí chonsalacht:
• Standard 10-year, 34-page passport (aged 18 and over): €80
• Gnáthphas 10 mbliana ina bhfuil 32 leathanach (18 mbliana agus níos sine): €80
• Large 10-year 66-page passport (aged 18 and over): €110
• Pas mór 10 mbliana ina bhfuil 66 leathanach (18 mbliana agus níos sine): €110
• 5-year passport (aged under 18 years): €30
• Pas 3 bliana (leanaí faoi bhun 3 bliana d’aois): €16
These fees do not include the charge payable to An Post for using the Passport Express service - see below
Ní áiríonn na táillí an muirear le haghaidh seirbhís na bPasanna Luais a úsáid
When applying in person at a Passport Office the fees are:
Nuair atáthar ag déanamh iarratais ar phas go pearsanta ag Oifig na bPasanna, tá na táillí mar seo a leanas:
• Standard 10-year, 32-page passport (aged 18 and over): €95
• Gnáthphas 10 mbliana ina bhfuil 32 leathanach (18 mbliana agus níos sine): €95
• Large 10-year 66-page passport (aged 18 and over): €125
• Pas mór 10 mbliana ina bhfuil 66 leathanach (18 mbliana agus níos sine): €125
• 5-year passport (aged under 18 years): €45
• Pas 3 bliana (leanaí faoi bhun 3 bliana d’aois): €31
Emergency charge: There is an additional charge of €70 for an adult and €38 for a child if you require your passport urgently (within 3 to 5 working days)
Muirear éigeandála: Gearrfar táille bhreise €55 ar dhuine fásta agus táille bhreise €30 ar leanbh má theastaíonn do phas uait go práinneach (laistigh de 5 lá oibre)
If you use An Post's Passport Express service there is an additional administrative charge, payable to An Post
Gearrfar táille bhreise €9.50 san iarratas ort má úsáideann tú Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais de chuid An Post
This charge is €9.50 per individual application. An Post also offers a 'Family Application' option whereby up to 4 passport applications may be enclosed in one envelope
Chomh maith leis sin, tairgeann An Post rogha ‘Iarratas Teaghlaigh’ trínar féidir 4 iarratas ar phas ar a mhéad do theaghlach a iamh i gclúdach amháin
The additional charge for a Family Application is €16
Is é €16 an táille bhreise ar Iarratas Teaghlaigh
The additional charge includes postage to and from the Passport Service
Folaíonn an táille bhreise postas chuig an tSeirbhís Pasanna agus amach uaithi
The Passport Express service is also available through UK Post Office branches in Northern Ireland (pdf)
Tá Sheirbhís na bPasanna Luais ar fáil trí bhrainsí Oifig Phoist na Ríochta Aontaithe i dTuaisceart Éireann (pdf) freisin
When applying for a passport through your Irish embassy or consulate, there may be additional administrative costs or handling charges depending on where you live

Más rud é go bhfuil tú ag cur isteach ar phas trí d'ambasáid Éireannach nó do chonsalacht Éireannach, d’fhéadfadh costais bhreise riaracháin nó táille láimhseála a bheith i gceist, ag brath ar an áit ina bhfuil cónaí ort
Check this in advance with the Irish embassy or consulate in the country in which you are living
Déan é seo a chinntiú roimh ré leis an ambasáid Éireannach nó leis an gconsalacht Éireannach sa tír ina bhfuil cónaí ort
You can pay for your Irish passport through Passport Express or at a Passport Office public counter if you are living in Ireland
Féadfaidh tú íoc as do phas Éireannach trí Sheirbhís na bPasanna Luais nó trí chuntar poiblí de chuid Oifig na bPasanna má tá cónaí ort in Éirinn
If you are using An Post's Passport Express service, you should pay the passport application fees and the extra Passport Express fee directly to An Post
Más rud é go bhfuil Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais de chuid An Post á húsáid agat, ba cheart duit na táillí iarratais ar phas agus táille bhreise Sheirbhís na bPasanna Luais a íoc go díreach le An Post
If you are living abroad, you can pay by post or at your nearest Irish embassy or consulate abroad
Más rud é go bhfuil cónaí ort thar lear, féadfaidh tú íoc as tríd an post nó tríd an ambasáid Éireannach nó tríd an gconsalacht Éireannach is cóngaraí duit thar lear
It is not possible to apply for your first Irish passport online
Ní féidir iarratas a dhéanamh ar phas Éireannach nua ar líne
It is also not currently possible to download the passport application form
Ní féidir ach oiread an fhoirm iarratais nach mór duit a chomhlánú a íoslódáil faoi láthair
If you are living in Ireland you can apply using Passport Express or in person at a Passport Office
Más rud é go bhfuil cónaí ort in Éirinn, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ach úsáid a bhaint as Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais nó go pearsanta ag oifig d’Oifig na bPasanna
If you are living abroad you can apply in person or using ordinary or registered post to your nearest Irish embassy or consulate
Má tá cónaí ort thar lear, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh go pearsanta nó gnáthphost nó post cláraithe a úsáid ag an ambasáid Éireannach nó ag an gconsalacht Éireannach is cóngaraí duit
If you are an Irish citizen living in the State, you should fill out form APS 1
Más saoránach Éireannach thú ar a bhfuil cónaí sa Stát, ba cheart duit foirm APS 1 a chomhlánú
You will find these forms at Garda stations and at any Post Office
Gheobhaidh tú na foirmeacha sin ag stáisiúin na nGardaí agus ag aon Oifig Phoist
If you are an Irish citizen living in Northern Ireland or outside Ireland you should fill out form APS 2
Más saoránach Éireannach thú ar a bhfuil cónaí i dTuaisceart Éireann nó lasmuigh d’Éirinn, ba cheart duit foirm APS 2 a chomhlánú
You can get the application form from the Irish embassy or consulate in the country where you live (or the closest embassy or consulate)
Is féidir leat an fhoirm iarratais a fháil ón ambasáid Éireannach nó ón gconsalacht Éireannach sa tír ina bhfuil cónaí ort (nó ón ambasáid nó ón gconsalacht is cóngaraí duit)
The Passport Express service including forms is available through certain UK Post Office branches in Northern Ireland (pdf)
Tá Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais, lena n-áirítear foirmeacha, ar fáil trí bhrainsí áirithe d’Oifig Phoist na Ríochta Aontaithe i dTuaisceart Éireann (pdf)
When you get the form, you should read the detailed notes provided with it, to help you complete the application form correctly
Tar éis duit an fhoirm a fháil, ba cheart duit na nótaí mionsonraithe a chuirtear ar fáil léi a léamh chun cabhrú leat an fhoirm iarratais a chomhlánú i gceart
The application form must be signed by an official witness who can confirm your identity and the details you have given
Ní mór an fhoirm iarratais a bheith sínithe ag finné oifigiúil a fhéadann d’aitheantas agus na sonraí a thug tú a dheimhniú
In all applications for a new passport, as well as the completed application form, you must submit:
I ngach iarratas ar phas nua, ní mór duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur isteach i dteannta na foirme iarratais comhlánaithe:
• Four passport photographs, 2 of which must be signed by a witness as per instructions provided with the application form
• Ceithre ghrianghraf pas, a bhfuil 2 cheann díobh sínithe ag finné de réir na dtreoracha a chuirtear ar fáil leis an bhfoirm iarratais
• Certified copy of photographic ID, for example, driving licence, college identification card, passport from another country (The application form witness can certify it)
• Cóip dheimhnithe d’aitheantas fótagrafach, mar shampla, ceadúnas tiomána, cárta aitheantais coláiste, pas ó thír eile (is féidir le finné na foirme iarratais í a dheimhniú)
• Proof of use of name, for example, payslip, bank statement, social welfare receipts
• Cruthúnas ar úsáid ainm, mar shampla, duillín pá, ráiteas bainc, admhálacha leasa shóisialaigh
• Proof of address, for example, utility bill, official correspondence from an Irish State agency (internet printouts are accepted if stamped by the issuing authority)

• Cruthúnas ar sheoladh, mar shampla, bille fóntais, comhfhreagras oifigiúil ó ghníomhaireacht Stáit Éireannach (Is féidir leat úsáid a bhaint as phriontaí idirlíon má tá siad stampáilte ag an údarás eisiúna)
All first-time applicants for an adult passport who are resident in the State have to supply a photocopy of their Public Services Card for identification purposes
Ón 29 Márta 2016, tá ar gach iarratasóir céaduaire ar phas do dhaoine fásta a chónaíonn in Éirinn fótachóip dá gCárta Seirbhísí Poiblí a sholáthar ar mhaithe le cuspóirí aitheantais
This also applies to adult passport applicants whose last passport was issued prior to January 2005 and has since been reported as lost, stolen or damaged

Baineann seo, chomh maith, le hiarratasóirí fásta ar phas ar eisíodh a bpas deireanach dóibh roimh Eanáir 2005 agus ar tuairiscíodh an pas amhail bheith caillte, goidte nó díobháil a bheith déanta dó idir an dá linn
They no longer need to supply a certified copy of photographic ID or proof of use of name
Ní gá d’iarratasóirí céaduaire cóip dheimhnithe a sholáthar a thuilleadh d’aitheantas grianghraif nó de chruthúnas i leith ainm a úsáid
Proof of address continues to be required
Teastaíonn cruthúnas seolta go fóill

If your previous passport was issued to you when you were a child and has not yet expired (or has only recently expired), your application is considered a renewal application and not a first-time application

Má éisíodh do phas deireanach duit nuair a bhí tú id leanbh, agus más rud é nach bhfuil sé imithe as feidhm (nó más le déanaí a d'imigh sé as feidhm), pléitear le d'iarratas mar iarratas athnuachan seachas iarratas nua
The additional documentation you must supply depends on how you obtained your Irish citizenship
Braitheann na doiciméid bhreise nach mór duit a sholáthar ar conas a fuair tú do shaoránacht Éireannach

If you are replacing a lost, stolen or damaged passport that was issued on or after 1 January 2005 and your new passport will issue in the same name, you do not have to supply the additional documentation

Má tá pas a cailleadh, a goideadh nó a ndearnadh díobháil dó á ionadú agat a eisíodh an 1 Eanáir 2005 nó ina dhiaidh sin agus má eiseofar do phas nua san ainm céanna, ní gá duit an cháipéisíocht bhreise a sholáthar
Born in Ireland - you should include:
Má rugadh in Éirinn thú - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a chur san áireamh:
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
Born abroad to Irish-born parent - you should include:
Má rugadh thar lear thú do thuismitheoir a rugadh in Éirinn - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur san áireamh:
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
• Your Irish-born parent’s birth certificate
• Teastas breithe do thuismitheora a rugadh in Éirinn
• Your parents’ civil marriage certificate (if applicable)
• Teastas pósta shibhialta do thuismitheoirí (má bhaineann)
Citizenship through foreign birth registration - you should include:
Saoránacht trí chlárúchán breithe thar lear - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur san áireamh:
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
• Your foreign birth registration certificate
• Do theastas clárúchán breithe thar lear
Born abroad and adopted under Irish law - you should include:
Más rud é gur rugadh thar lear thú agus gur uchtaíodh faoi dhlí na hÉireann thú - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur san áireamh:
• Your certificate of entry in the Register of Intercountry Adoptions (If adopted abroad your adoption must be entered in the Register of Intercountry Adoptions)
• Do theastas iontrála sa Chlár um Uchtuithe idir Thíortha (Má ghlac thar lear mór do uchtáil a iontráil i gClár um Uchtuithe idir Tíortha)
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
• Your adoptive Irish parent’s birth certificate or Irish passport
• Teastas breithe nó pas Éireannach do thuismitheora Éireannaigh uchtála
Post-nuptial citizenship - you should include:
Saoránacht iarphósta - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur san áireamh:
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
Citizenship through naturalisation - you should include:
Saoránacht trí eadóirseacht - ba cheart duit na nithe seo a leanas a chur san áireamh:
• Your civil marriage or civil partnership certificate (if you have changed your surname)
• Do theastas pósta shibhialta nó páirtnéireachta sibhialta (má d’athraigh tú do shloinne)
If your documents are not in English you must also supply a certified English version, translated by a registered translator
Mura bhfuil do chuid doiciméad i mBéarla, caithfidh tú leagan deimhnithe Béarla arna aistriú ag aistritheoir cláraithe a sholáthar
You may also be required to provide further information and/or attend for interview
Is féidir go n-éileofar ort tuilleadh faisnéise a chur ar fáil agus/nó freastal ar agallamh freisin
Processing times for passports
Amanna próiseála do phasanna
The Passport Service strongly recommends that you apply for your passport at least 6 weeks prior to your travel date
Molann an tSeirbhís Pas go láidir go ndéanfá iarratas ar do phas ar a laghad 6 seachtaine roimh do dháta taistil
Applying through the Passport Express service ensures that properly completed renewal applications will normally be processed in 15 working days
Trí iarratas a dhéanamh trí Sheirbhís na bPasanna Luais, cinntíonn sé go bpróiseálfar iarratais athnuachan chomhlánaithe laistigh de 15 lá oibre de ghnáth
For first-time applications you should allow at least 20 working days for your application to be processed
I gcás iarratais chéaduaire, ba chóir duit ar a laghad 20 lá oibre a cheadú chun d'iarratas a phróiseáil
This period may be extended at certain times of the year due to increased application numbers
D’fhéadfadh go sínfí an tréimhse sin ag tráthanna áirithe sa bhliain mar thoradh ar líon méadaithe iarratas
Check the Passport Service website for current processing time information
Seiceáil láithreán Gréasáin na Seirbhíse Pasanna chun faisnéis reatha faoi amanna próiseála a fháil
If you are due to travel in less than 3 weeks you should apply in person to a Passport Office
Ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh go pearsanta chuig ceann ar bith d’Oifigí na bPasanna sa chás go mbeidh tú ag taisteal laistigh de 3 seachtaine
To apply in person at a Passport Office, you should book an appointment online
D’fhonn iarratas a dhéanamh go pearsanta chuig ceann ar bith d’Oifigí na bPasanna, ba cheart duit coinne a chur in áirithe ar líne
If you require a passport urgently, you should contact the Passport Service
Más rud é go dteastaíonn pas uait go práinneach, ba cheart duit dul i dteagmháil leis an tSeirbhís Pasanna
If living abroad, in general you should allow at least 6-8 weeks for the processing of your passport via your local embassy or consulate
Má tá cónaí ort thar lear, ba cheart duit 6-8 seachtaine ar a laghad a fhágáil le haghaidh chun d’iarratas a phróiseáil tríd an ambasáid nó tríd an gconsalacht is cóngaraí duit
Tracking the progress of your passport application
An dul chun cinn ar d’iarratas ar phas a rianú
The Passport Service provides a Passport Tracking Service
Cuireann an tSeirbhís Pasanna Seirbhís um Rianú Pas ar fáil
This service allows you to check the status of your application online
Ligeann an tseirbhís seo duit stádas d’iarratais a sheiceáil ar líne
In order to do this, you must have the application number from your form (available in the top left-hand corner of the form) to do this
Chun amhlaidh a dhéanamh, ní mór duit an uimhir iarratais ó d’fhoirm (le fáil ag barr na foirme ar chlé) a bheith agat
When you receive your passport, you should sign it
Nuair a fhaigheann tú do phas, ba chóir duit é a shíniú
In the case of a child’s passport, the child should sign it
I gcás phas linbh, ba chóir don pháiste é a shíniú
If the child is not able to sign their name, it should be left blank
Mura bhfuil an leanbh in ann a ainm a shíniú, ba cheart a pas a fhágáil bán
If applying from within the State, you should use Passport Express
Ba cheart duit úsáid a bhaint as Seirbhís na bPasanna Luais más ag déanamh iarratais ó áit laistigh den Stát atá tú
Hand in your application at your nearest Service Plus Post Office
Cuir d’iarratas isteach ag an Oifig Phoist ‘Service Plus’ is cóngaraí duit
If you have immediate travel plans or a necessity to travel for reasons of family emergency, contact a Passport Office
Más rud é go bhfuil pleananna taistil láithrigh agat, nó go bhfuil gá le taisteal chun críche éigeandáil teaghlaigh agat, déan teagmháil le ceann ar bith d’Oifigí na bPasanna

If applying from outside the State, send the completed application to the nearest Irish embassy or consulate, or hand it in at the nearest participating Northern Ireland Post Office if using Passport Express

Más rud é go bhfuil tú ag déanamh iarratais ó áit lasmuigh den Stát, seol an t-iarratas comhlánaithe chuig an ambasáid Éireannach nó chuig an gconsalacht Éireannach is cóngaraí duit, nó cuir isteach é ag an Oifig Phoist rannpháirteach is cóngaraí i dTuaisceart Éireann más ag úsáid Sheirbhís na bPasanna Luais atá tú
You can order birth, marriage, civil partnership and adoption certificates online from the HSE
Is féidir leat teastas breithe, teastas pósta, teastas páirtnéireachta sibhialta agus teastas uchtála a ordú ar líne ó FSS
You can order a certificate of entry in the Register of Intercountry Adoptions from the Adoption Authority
Is féidir leat teastas iontrála sa Chlár um Uchtuithe idir Thíortha a ordú ón Údarás Uchtála
Information on how to obtain a foreign birth registration certificate is available on the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade website
Tá faisnéis faoi conas teastas clárúchán breithe thar lear a fháil ar fáil ar láithreán Gréasáin na Roinne Gnóthaí Eachtracha agus Trádála
